<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin"></a>

# EditorDebuggerPlugin

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A base class to implement debugger plugins.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**EditorDebuggerPlugin** provides functions related to the editor side of the debugger.

To interact with the debugger, an instance of this class must be added to the editor via [EditorPlugin.add_debugger_plugin()](EditorPlugin.md#EditorPlugin_method_add_debugger_plugin).

Once added, the [_setup_session()](EditorDebuggerPlugin.md#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__setup_session) callback will be called for every [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) available to the plugin, and when new ones are created (the sessions may be inactive during this stage).

You can retrieve the available [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md)\\ s via [get_sessions()](EditorDebuggerPlugin.md#EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_sessions) or get a specific one via [get_session()](EditorDebuggerPlugin.md#EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_session).




```gdscript
    @tool
    extends EditorPlugin

    class ExampleEditorDebugger extends EditorDebuggerPlugin:

        func _has_capture(capture):
            # Return true if you wish to handle messages with the prefix "my_plugin:".
            return capture == "my_plugin"

        func _capture(message, data, session_id):
            if message == "my_plugin:ping":
                get_session(session_id).send_message("my_plugin:echo", data)
                return true
            return false

        func _setup_session(session_id):
            # Add a new tab in the debugger session UI containing a label.
            var label = Label.new()
            label.name = "Example plugin" # Will be used as the tab title.
            label.text = "Example plugin"
            var session = get_session(session_id)
            # Listens to the session started and stopped signals.
            session.started.connect(func (): print("Session started"))
            session.stopped.connect(func (): print("Session stopped"))
            session.add_session_tab(label)

    var debugger = ExampleEditorDebugger.new()

    func _enter_tree():
        add_debugger_plugin(debugger)

    func _exit_tree():
        remove_debugger_plugin(debugger)
```




To connect on the running game side, use the [EngineDebugger](EngineDebugger.md) singleton:




```gdscript
    extends Node

    func _ready():
        EngineDebugger.register_message_capture("my_plugin", _capture)
        EngineDebugger.send_message("my_plugin:ping", ["test"])

    func _capture(message, data):
        # Note that the "my_plugin:" prefix is not used here.
        if message == "echo":
            prints("Echo received:", data)
            return true
        return false
```




\ **Note:** While the game is running, [@GlobalScope.print()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_print) and similar functions *called in the editor* do not print anything, the Output Log prints only game messages.

## Method Descriptions

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__breakpoint_set_in_tree"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_breakpoint_set_in_tree**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md), line\: [int](int.md), enabled\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__breakpoint_set_in_tree)

Override this method to be notified when a breakpoint is set in the editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__breakpoints_cleared_in_tree"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_breakpoints_cleared_in_tree**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__breakpoints_cleared_in_tree)

Override this method to be notified when all breakpoints are cleared in the editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__capture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_capture**\ (\ message\: [String](String.md), data\: [Array](Array.md), session_id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__capture)

Override this method to process incoming messages. The `session_id` is the ID of the [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) that received the `message`. Use [get_session()](EditorDebuggerPlugin.md#EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_session) to retrieve the session. This method should return ``true`` if the message is recognized.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__goto_script_line"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_goto_script_line**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md), line\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__goto_script_line)

Override this method to be notified when a breakpoint line has been clicked in the debugger breakpoint panel.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__has_capture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_has_capture**\ (\ capture\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__has_capture)

Override this method to enable receiving messages from the debugger. If `capture` is "my_message" then messages starting with "my_message:" will be passed to the [_capture()](EditorDebuggerPlugin.md#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__capture) method.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__setup_session"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_setup_session**\ (\ session_id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_private_method__setup_session)

Override this method to be notified whenever a new [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) is created. Note that the session may be inactive during this stage.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_session"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) **get_session**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_session)

Returns the [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) with the given `id`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_sessions"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md) **get_sessions**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorDebuggerPlugin_method_get_sessions)

Returns an array of [EditorDebuggerSession](EditorDebuggerSession.md) currently available to this debugger plugin.

\ **Note:** Sessions in the array may be inactive, check their state via [EditorDebuggerSession.is_active()](EditorDebuggerSession.md#EditorDebuggerSession_method_is_active).
